Key Match Events: In the 34th minute, Lisandro Martínez scored off a header from a corner kick to give Argentina a 1-0 lead.
Ecuador had a penalty kick opportunity early in the second half, but Enner Valencia missed it off the post.
Kevin Rodríguez scored for Ecuador in stoppage time, keeping the match tied at 1-1.
Argentina won the penalty shootout 4-2, advancing to the semifinals.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi set the record for the most minutes played in Copa América history during the match.
Argentina is making a strong case to defend its title after beating a tough Ecuador team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fox Soccer shared several highlights of the match, including Lisandro Martínez's goal and Enner Valencia's missed penalty.
